ALLEGED.Definition: said, without proof, to have happened

JIHADI.Definition: a Muslim extremist or fanatic who fights for his religion

SCANDAL.Definition: an event that caused public feelings of shock and anger

ISLAMOPHOBIA.Definition: dislike or fear against Islam or Muslims

HOAX.Definition: a plan to trick or deceive people

LIGHTBULB.Definition: round glass part of an electric light or lamp

BLURRED.Definition: not able to be seen clearly

THE NAKED EYE.Definition: someone without a special way to see it

HARMLESS.Definition: not able or likely to do damage or harm

ETHNICITIES.Definition: groups of people with the same history and traditions

INFLUX.Definition: number of people that arrived at the same time

DISCRIMINATION.Definition: bad and different from others treatment because of their race or nationality

SECULAR.Definition: where no religion is officially taught

CURRICULUM.Definition: program of subjects taught in schools

LACK.Definition: the fact that there aren't any

SUBURB.Definition: area on the edge of the city

GOVERNORS.Definition: members of group deciding about school's management

OUTLETS.Definition: companies or channels which provide news

RUMOURS.Definition: information shared among people without proof of being true

TASK FORCE.Definition: group of people specially organised for that job or task

MASTERMIND.Definition: the one who had planned and organised it all

RECRUITER.Definition: person who found people and made them part of the organisation

GOVERNOR.Definition: member of group deciding about school's management

TURNING AROUND.Definition: improving the situation, making them successful

PLACED A SEED OF DOUBT.Definition: made them have doubts or questions

BYPRODUCT.Definition: something that was not planned, but happened as a result of something else

IN BROAD DAYLIGHT.Definition: during the day, when anyone could see what was happening

A TALKING POINT.Definition: a topic that people talked about a lot
